headers.subject: RE: [tools-dev] STLport-4.0 patch for Solaris 8
headers.x-spam-status: No, score=-6.6 required=5.0 tests=BAYES_00,RCVD_IN_DNSWL_MED autolearn=disabled version=3.2.4
headers.received: from patan.sun.com (192.18.98.43) by h12.sny.collab.net with SMTP; 18 Jun 2001 20:27:47 -0000

body.para: Yes, adding -I/usr/include to the sunpro.mak file will have the same affect as my changes when building the STLport-4.0 package. However, this solution does not fix a problem on Solaris 8 that shows up when OpenOffice.org sources include STLport-4.0 headers. In such cases, you will get numerous "include file not found" errors.
The patch I have solves the latter problem as well as the first one that you reported in issue 693.
Can you try it out and see if you encounter any problems and/or bugs in my implementation?

quote.quotepara: Mailing-List: contact tools-dev-help@openoffice.org; run by ezmlm X-No-Archive: yes list-help: <mailto:tools-dev-help@openoffice.org> list-unsubscribe: <mailto:tools-dev-unsubscribe@openoffice.org> list-post: <mailto:dev@tools.openoffice.org> Delivered-To: mailing list tools-dev@openoffice.org From: Markus Döhr <doehrm@aubi.de> To: "'dev@tools.openoffice.org'" <dev@tools.openoffice.org> MIME-Version: 1.0 Subject: RE: [tools-dev] STLport-4.0 patch for Solaris 8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit X-MIME-Autoconverted: from quoted-printable to 8bit by single.eng.sun.com id NAA20664
On Solaris 8, the STLport-4.0 package that is downloaded from www.stlport.org will not compile with the Forte 6 Update 1 compiler on Solaris 8.
